private_information: I represent an operational analyst that interprets available actions and their informal constraints and effects.
I can parse action names and map required preconditions and resulting add and delete effects into a canonical action summary.
actor.goal: Produce a concise formal summary of each action's preconditions, add effects and delete effects and list all objects referenced.

private_information: I represent an observation extractor that canonicalizes the raw initial statement into a list of ground facts and the explicit goal.
I avoid inventing missing facts and I preserve object identifiers as given.
sensor.goal: Extract and canonicalize all initial ground facts and the goal from the use-case statement and report any ambiguous or out-of-range object references.

private_information: I represent a temporal and causal auditor whose role is to identify and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties and to reject or flag inconsistent temporal assumptions.
I ensure that action effects are causally consistent and that any shortcuts are replaced by explicit causal links or marked for orchestrator resolution.
auditor.goal: Audit the actor and sensor outputs for temporal and causal consistency, remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts, and provide explicit corrected causal constraints when possible.

private_information: I receive canonicalized action summaries, initial facts, and audit annotations and I produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards planner.
I must keep agent actions distinct and integrate corrections provided by the auditor.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate upstream outputs and emit a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that encodes the goal next object_11 object_9 while preserving action distinctions and auditor corrections.

public_information: Available actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted each parameterized by object references.
Action paltry requires preconditions hand object_0 cats object_1 texture object_2 vase object_0 object_1 next object_1 object_2 and makes next object_0 object_2 true and vase object_0 object_1 false.
Action sip requires hand object_0 cats object_1 texture object_2 next object_0 object_2 next object_1 object_2 and makes vase object_0 object_1 true and next object_0 object_2 false.
Action clip requires hand object_0 sneeze object_1 texture object_2 next object_1 object_2 next object_0 object_2 and makes vase object_0 object_1 true and next object_0 object_2 false.

Action wretched requires sneeze object_0 texture object_1 texture object_2 stupendous object_3 next object_0 object_1 collect object_1 object_3 collect object_2 object_3 and makes next object_0 object_2 true and next object_0 object_1 false.
Action memory requires cats object_0 spring object_1 spring object_2 next object_0 object_1 and makes next object_0 object_2 true and next object_0 object_1 false.
Action tightfisted requires hand object_0 sneeze object_1 texture object_2 next object_1 object_2 vase object_0 object_1 and makes next object_0 object_2 true and vase object_0 object_1 false.

Initial ground facts include cats object_0 collect object_10 object_2 collect object_5 object_1 collect object_6 object_1 collect object_7 object_1 collect object_8 object_2 collect object_9 object_2 hand object_11 next object_0 object_5 next object_11 object_8 next object_3 object_5 next object_4 object_10 sneeze object_3 sneeze object_4 spring object_5 spring object_8 stupendous object_1 stupendous object_2 texture object_10 texture object_5 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8 texture object_9.
The declared goal is next object_11 object_9.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst that reads the public definitions of actions and infers formal preconditions add effects and delete effects without emitting PDDL. Provide one-line canonical summaries for each action with the parameter positions treated as object placeholders and list all referenced predicate schemas.
analyze.prompt: Parse the action descriptions and produce for each action a structured summary that lists parameters positions, explicit preconditions, add effects and delete effects. Provide a consolidated list of all predicate names and object placeholders referenced. Do not output PDDL. Use concise canonical notation.

extract.system_prompt: You are a sensor that converts a natural language initial statement into a canonical list of ground facts and an explicit goal. Preserve object identifiers as given and flag duplicates or ambiguous references. Do not invent facts.
extract.prompt: From the provided public information and statement extract all ground facts that are explicitly given and the explicit goal. Return the facts as a list of atom strings and return the goal as a single atom string. Flag any object identifiers that appear outside the declared range.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal auditor that inspects action summaries and initial facts to detect bookkeeping shortcuts and temporal inconsistencies. Replace shortcuts such as quota tokens or implicit post-hoc corrections with explicit causal constraints or mark them for orchestrator resolution. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Take the actor analysis and the extracted initial facts and produce an audit report that lists any causal inconsistencies temporal ordering requirements and any bookkeeping shortcuts. For each shortcut propose an explicit causal constraint or flag it if it cannot be resolved with current information. Keep recommendations precise and actionable.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert integrator that must produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Keep actions distinct by prefixing action names with agent identifiers if needed. Apply auditor corrections and the canonicalized initial facts. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is FastDownwards compatible and avoids nonstandard extensions.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the provided action summaries initial facts and audit report. Generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the available predicates objects initial state and the goal next object_11 object_9. Keep agent actions distinct where applicable. Use only STRIPS and standard PDDL constructs supported by FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> and output nothing else.
